items.title: Live: Will Nifty be able to hold its gains to the second day? | Opening Bell
items.description: Nifty snapped its 10-day losing streak yesterday, closing over 1% higher as most index constituents participated in the rally. The market witnessed strong breadth, with eight stocks advancing for every one that declined in the last session. The 22,000 level remains a critical support for Nifty, adding to the significance of this rebound. All sectors ended in positive territory, with metal, IT, and auto stocks leading the recovery. Going ahead, experts now watch out Nifty's resistance around 22,500 and support around 21m960. This morning, global cues were positive. All major averages in the Wall Street ended over a percent higher. Asia-Pacfific markets also started the day good as US President Donald Trump granted one-month tariff exemption on automakers. Among stocks, watch out for Zydus Life, Wipro, and LIC Housing in today's trading session. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Nirav Chheda, Assistant Vice President, Equity Derivatives & Technical Research- Retail, Nirmal Bang and Anshul Saigal, Market Expert.

items.title: RPP Infra Projects shares in focus on orders win worth Rs 80.98 crore
items.description: RPP Infra Projects Share Price | The company had reported a 17 percent jump in its consolidated December quarter net profit at Rs 18.87 crore, YoY.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty suggests a firm opening; Angel One, Zydus Life, Galaxy Surfactants
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Stocks like Wipro, Walchandnagar Industries, Hindustan Zinc, R Systems International, Kirloskar Industries, Zaggle Prepaid Ocean Services, Dalmia Bharat, Sterlite Technologies, Banswara Syntex, Lorenzini Apparels, Adani Enterprises, and Manappuram Finance will be in focus on March 6.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) extended their selling on tenth day on March 5 as they sold equities worth Rs 2895 crore. However, domestic institutional investors (DIIs) also extended their buying on 20th day as they bought equities worth Rs 3370 crore, on the same day.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: TCS, Zydus Lifesciences, RPP Infra Projects, LIC Housing, Galaxy Surfactants, Route Mobile in focus on 6 March
items.description: Stocks to Watch, Mar 6: Stocks like Wipro, Walchandnagar Industries, Hindustan Zinc, R Systems International, Kirloskar Industries, Zaggle Prepaid Ocean Services, Dalmia Bharat, Sterlite Technologies, Banswara Syntex, Lorenzini Apparels, Adani Enterprises, and Manappuram Finance will be in focus on March 6.

items.title: Wall Street rebounds as investors weigh tariff uncertainty, mixed economic data
items.description: Investor sentiment got a boost after Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick indicated late Tuesday that progress was being made toward a tariff agreement with Canada and Mexico.

items.title: BofA sees Nifty touching 25,000 by December, expects negative returns for small, midcaps in 2025
items.description: BofA said that it favours rate-sensitive domestic cyclicals such as financials and autos, expecting RBI rate cuts to boost economic and credit growth.

items.title: Sandeep Parekh on riding the storm and agenda for the new SEBI Chairman | Political Economy
items.description: Ace securities lawyer, Sandeep Parekh on the stock market crash and why investors need to ride out the storm. Even as the government and regulators need to urgently revise laws regulating the financial sector.

items.title: Select small and midcaps jump up to 15% as broader markets extend recovery: Here are the movers
items.description: The broader market indices have now stayed in the green for a third consecutive session.

items.title: Taking Stock: Nifty at two-week high above 22,500, Sensex reclaims 74,000 on tariff relief, oil cooloff
items.description: Indian indices opened higher but erased the gains in the first hour, only to rebound on buying across sectors, regaining the losses to end near day's high.

items.title: Hexaware Technologies shares rise 3% after partnering with San Francisco Unicorns in Major League Cricket
items.description: Hexaware Tech share price: As part of the association, the technology solutions company will be recognized as the San Francisco Unicorns' official partner

items.title: Coal India, Amber Enterprises, Varun Beverages shares jump up to 9% on higher sales hope after IMD's heatwave warnings
items.description: IMD said it is expecting above-normal temperatures and heatwave days across India from March onwards, following an unusually warm February.

items.title: Inox India shares gain over 5% on Rs 190 crore orders from Europe, Australia
items.description: The company also received orders for LNG and industrial gas storage tanks, vaporizers, and other cryogenic equipment, with deliveries scheduled across Europe, the US, and India.

items.title: Hindalco, Tata Steel, other metal stocks rise up to 7% on dollar decline, China stimulus hopes
items.description: The rally in the stock prices pushed Nifty Metal up by nearly 3 percent to 8,918, extending gains for the fourth consecutive session.

items.title: Asian Paints shares hit three-year high as crude oil slumps to multi-year lows
items.description: Brent crude futures have plunged 6.5 percent over the last four sessions, settling at $68.34 per barrel—their lowest since December 2021.

items.title: Equity market correction may weigh on consumption in FY26: Economists
items.description: Slowing bank credit growth, sustained FII outflows, and elevation valuations of Indian equities add to the cautious outlook. As investor sentiment weakens, household spending patterns could shift, affecting demand across key sectors in FY26, say economists.

items.title: PVR INOX shares rise as Kotak Institutional upgrades to 'Buy' on better cost controls amid weak collections
items.description: Kotak Institutional Equities in its upgrade cited that the recent sharp correction in PVR INOX's stock is overdone. The downgrade in EBITDA estimates comes on the back of persistent weakness in Bollywood box office collections.

items.title: Gensol shares crash another 10% over 'falsification' of data, EPC player blames liquidity crunch for downgrade
items.description: Anmol Singh Jaggi, the Chairman and Managing Director of Gensol Engineering said the business has faced a temporary liquidity mismatch caused by simultaneous execution of several large-scale projects.

items.title: Reliance Industries shares rise on Jefferies' bullish call, Kotak Institutional's upgrade
items.description: Jefferies reiterated its 'Buy' call on RIL with a target price of Rs 1,600 per share, while Kotak Institutional upgraded the stock to 'Buy', stating that the risk-reward appear favourable now.

items.title: Galaxy Surfactants shares rise 5% as firm partners with a global client for EPC services
items.description: Galaxy Surfactants Limited, through its group entities, has formed a strategic alliance with a key global client to oversee the complete development and delivery of a Performance Surfactants and Specialty Ingredients manufacturing facility at an international site.

items.title: Crude sensitive stocks surge as oil prices slip to six-month low; Asian Paints, BPCL, HPCL, Apollo Tyre gain upto 4.5%
items.description: A decline in crude prices benefits manufacturers dependent on crude-based inputs by lowering their production costs. This reduction provides them with greater flexibility to expand profit margins, improving overall profitability.

items.title: SEBI tightens the noose on derivative trading
items.description: SEBI's latest proposal to tighten derivative trading limits has sparked concerns among traders and investors. With stricter position limits and increased regulatory uncertainty, market liquidity and trading volumes are expected to take a hit.

items.title: Mukka Proteins shares rise 6% on domestic, international orders worth Rs 44 crore
items.description: Mukka Proteins has announced key supply orders from both domestic and international clients, further expanding its market footprint.

items.title: Accumulate Transport Corporation of India; target of Rs 1172: Asit C Mehta
items.description: Asit C Mehta recommended accumulate rating on Transport Corporation of India with a target price of Rs 1172 in its research report dated February 24 2025.

items.title: Shakti Pumps hits 5% upper circuit for 2nd day amid Rs 24 crore MEDA order
items.description: Shakti Pumps specialises in manufacturing pumps, motors, and spare parts

items.title: Route Mobile shares soar 10% after promoter Proximus Global inks pact with Nokia
items.description: Route Mobile promoter--Proximus Global has joined forces with Nokia to provide network APIs aimed at helping developers build innovative enterprise applications.

items.title: REC, PFC shares rally up to 3% after Macquarie rates 'Outperform', says structural story intact
items.description: The Macquarie note said that the recent fall in stock prices were driven by weak sentiment in PSU shares, but concerns over decline in growth, rising competitive intensity and softer demand for power are overblown.

items.title: Stocks to Watch on March 6: TCS, LIC Housing Finance, Wipro, Zydus Lifesciences and more
items.description: On March 6, several key stocks are in focus. TCS has partnered with Vantage Towers to launch a digital service platform aimed at enhancing property owner experiences in telecom tower leasing. LIC Housing Finance plans to raise ₹1,22,500 crore in FY2025-26 through various instruments, including NCDs and ECBs, to bolster its funding capacity.

items.title: FII net sell shares worth Rs 2,377 crore, DIIs net buyers of Rs 1,617 crore
items.description: Sensex and Nifty 50 closed higher for a second consecutive session on March 6, supported by strong gains in Reliance Industries. The index heavyweight led the uptrend, lifting other crude-sensitive stocks like Asian Paints and BPCL.
